htmlContent:
Figma Guide

Figma is a powerful cloud-based UI/UX design tool that allows designers and developers to collaborate in real-time. It's perfect for creating wireframes, prototypes, and scalable design systems.

Key Features

  • Vector Editing & Components
  • Design Systems & Shared Styles
  • Prototyping & Interactive Mockups
  • Collaboration, Comments & Version History
  • Plugins & Integrations

Best Practices

  • Organize components and layers systematically
  • Use shared libraries for consistent styles
  • Keep designs responsive and scalable
  • Use prototyping to test user flows early
  • Collaborate with developers for handoff efficiency

Example: Simple Component Setup

{
  "Button": {
    "type": "component",
    "variant": "primary",
    "states": ["default", "hover", "active"]
  }
}

Next Steps

  • Explore advanced prototyping and animations
  • Build scalable design systems for multiple projects
  • Integrate Figma with tools like Zeplin or Storybook
  • Use version control for team collaboration
  • Practice user testing with interactive prototypes

By following these practices, designers and developers can efficiently create visually appealing, consistent, and user-friendly interfaces using Figma.
